sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"比赛，竞争"之意。
means: competition ： 多指体育运动中的各项比赛、角逐，也指知识、技巧等方面的竞赛。
contest ： 多指在音乐、书法、演讲等方面所进行的比赛或竞争。其结果，由评判委员会裁决。
match ： 通常指体育运动项目的比赛，隐含势均力敌意味。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"比赛"之意。
means: game ： 指决定胜负的比赛，多以个人对抗或集体对抗形式根据一定的规则进行。
match ： 多指重要的，参加队数较多的大型比赛。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"相称，比得上，与……相比"之意。
means: match ： 指对手之间力量、强度、性能或利益等的较量或竞争。
equal ： 指在数量、价值或程度等方面已完全相等。
rival ： 指某人或某物在和对手竞争中，在能力、质量等方面都能与之相匹敌，都能比得上。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gemæcca 'mate, companion', of West Germanic origin; related to the base of make
late Middle English (in the sense 'wick of a candle'): from Old French meche, perhaps from Latin myxa 'spout of a lamp', later 'lamp wick'

entry.def: A match is an organized game of football, tennis, cricket, or some other sport.

example.ex: He was watching a football match...
example.tran: 他正在观看一场足球比赛。
法国队以28比19赢得了这场比赛。

entry.def: A match is a small wooden stick with a substance on one end that produces a flame when you rub it along the rough side of a matchbox.

example.ex: ...a packet of cigarettes  and a box of matches.

entry.def: If something of a particular colour or design matches another thing, they have the same colour or design, or have a pleasing appearance when they are used together.

example.ex: Her nails were painted bright red to match her dress...
example.tran: 她的指甲涂成了大红色，为的是与裙子相配。

entry.tran: （数量或质量）比得上,与…不相上下,使一致
entry.def: If something such as an amount or a quality matches with another amount or quality, they are both the same or equal. If you match two things, you make them the same or equal.

example.ex: Their strengths in memory and spatial skills matched...
example.tran: 他们在记忆力和空间技能方面势均力敌。

example.ex: Our value system does not match with their value system.
example.tran: 我们的价值体系和他们的并不相同。

entry.def: If one thing matches another,  they are connected or suit each other  in some way.

example.ex: The students are asked to match the books with the authors...
example.tran: 要求学生把书籍与作者对应起来。

example.ex: We will try to match you to employers with the vacancies you are looking for...
example.tran: 我们会争取为你找到提供你所需职位的用人单位。

entry.def: If a combination of things or people is a good match, they have a pleasing effect when placed or used together.

example.ex: Helen's choice of lipstick was a good match for her skin-tone...
example.tran: 海伦选择的唇膏很适合她的肤色。

example.ex: Moira was a perfect match for him.
example.tran: 莫伊拉和他简直是绝配。

entry.def: If you match something, you are as good as it or equal to it, for example in speed, size, or quality.

example.ex: They played some fine attacking football, but I think we matched them in every respect...
example.tran: 他们的攻势足球踢得不错，不过我认为我们各方面和他们比起来都不逊色。

example.ex: His record has never been matched.

entry.def: In a sport or other contest, if you match one person or team against another, in sports or other contests, you make them compete with each other to see which one is better.

example.ex: The finals of the Championship begin today, matching the United States against France...
example.tran: 锦标赛决赛于今天打响，由美国队对法国队。

example.ex: Lewis is matched against the WBO's heavyweight champion, Tommy Morrison.
example.tran: 刘易斯对决世界拳击组织的重量级拳王汤米·莫里森。

entry.tran: 遇到强劲的对手;棋逢对手
entry.def: If you meet your match, you find that you are competing or fighting against someone who you cannot beat because they are as good as you, or better than you.

example.ex: I had finally met my match in power and intellect.
example.tran: 我终于遇上了与我在力量与智力上不相上下的劲敌。

entry.def: If one person or thing is no match for another, they are unable to compete successfully with the other person or thing.

example.ex: I was no match for a man with such power...
example.tran: 我根本不是这样强大的男人的对手。

example.ex: Hand-held guns proved no match for heavy armor.
example.tran: 结果证明，手持枪械无法同重型装甲抗衡。

means.word_mean: 1. lighter consisting of a thin piece of wood or cardboard tipped with combustible chemical; ignites with friction;

sentences.sentence: "he always carries matches to light his pipe"

means.word_mean: 2. a formal contest in which two or more persons or teams compete
3. a burning piece of wood or cardboard;

sentences.sentence: "if you drop a match in there the whole place will explode"

means.word_mean: 4. an exact duplicate;

sentences.sentence: "when a match is found an entry is made in the notebook"

means.word_mean: 5. the score needed to win a match
6. a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect
7. a person who is of equal standing with another in a group
8. a pair of people who live together;

sentences.sentence: "a married couple from Chicago"

means.word_mean: 9. something that resembles or harmonizes with;

sentences.sentence: "that tie makes a good match with your jacket"

means.word_mean: 1. be compatible, similar or consistent; coincide in their characteristics;

sentences.sentence: "The two stories don't agree in many details"
"The handwriting checks with the signature on the check"
"The suspect's fingerprints don't match those on the gun"

means.word_mean: 2. provide funds complementary to;

sentences.sentence: "The company matched the employees' contributions"

means.word_mean: 3. bring two objects, ideas, or people together;

sentences.sentence: "This fact is coupled to the other one"
"Matchmaker, can you match my daughter with a nice young man?"
"The student was paired with a partner for collaboration on the project"

means.word_mean: 4. be equal to in quality or ability;

sentences.sentence: "Nothing can rival cotton for durability"
"Your performance doesn't even touch that of your colleagues"
"Her persistence and ambition only matches that of her parents"

means.word_mean: 5. make correspond or harmonize;

sentences.sentence: "Match my sweater"

means.word_mean: 6. satisfy or fulfill;

sentences.sentence: "meet a need"
"this job doesn't match my dreams"

means.word_mean: 7. give or join in marriage
8. set into opposition or rivalry;

sentences.sentence: "let them match their best athletes against ours"
"pit a chess player against the Russian champion"
"He plays his two children off against each other"

means.word_mean: 9. be equal or harmonize;

sentences.sentence: "The two pieces match"

means.word_mean: 10. make equal, uniform, corresponding, or matching;

sentences.sentence: "let's equalize the duties among all employees in this office"
"The company matched the discount policy of its competitors"

They can match conventional motor cars in performance and safety

RelayRides and SnapGoods match up owners and renters; smartphones with GPS let people see where the nearest rentable car is parked; social networks provide a way to check up on people and build trust; and online payment systems handle the billing
Its severity is no match for the Great Depression of 1929.

means.word_mean: 比赛, 竞赛

sentences.en: We had a friendly match with them.
sentences.cn: 我们与他们进行了一场友谊比赛。

means.word_mean: 对手, 敌手

sentences.en: Bill is no match for his younger brother at chess.
sentences.cn: 比尔下棋不是他弟弟的对手。

means.word_mean: 相似之物, 相配之物

sentences.en: The chairs and the desk are a good match.
sentences.cn: 这些椅子和这种书桌很相配。

sentences.en: The hat is a match for the coat.

means.word_mean: 婚姻; 婚姻对象

sentences.en: Both her daughters made good matches.
sentences.cn: 她两个女儿的婚姻都很美满。

means.word_mean: 使较量, 使比赛

sentences.en: No one matches him when it comes to swimming.
sentences.cn: 谈到游泳, 没有人比得过他。

means.word_mean: 使结婚，为…安排婚姻

sentences.en: The duke matched his daughter with the king's son.
sentences.cn: 公爵把女儿嫁给了王子。

means.word_mean: (使)相配; (使)相称

sentences.cn: 那条领带跟你的西装很相配。

sentences.en: He promised to match me a piece of cloth.
sentences.cn: 他答应过替我找一块布料来配。

jushi.english: I want to buy a box of matches.
The table tennis match came off last week.
jushi.chinese: 那场乒乓球赛在上周结束了。

jushi.english: She hoped to arrange a match between her daughter and that young man.
jushi.chinese: 她希望她的女儿能和那位年轻人结婚。
